content: +++http://apnews.myway.com/article/20090425/D97P6KT81.html After the meeting, Napolitano issued a statement saying the department "has fixed the internal process that allowed this document to be released before it was ready." So, the RELEASE of the document is the problem. You, know...the fact that we found out her views..not the fact that she holds those views..
reply: +++http://apnews.myway.com/article/20090425/D97P6KT81.html After the meeting, Napolitano issued a statement saying the department "has fixed the internal process that allowed this document to be released before it was ready." So, the RELEASE of the document is the problem. You, know...the fact that we found out her views..not the fact that she holds those views..
title: How to say sorry..without really saying anything..

content: Homeland Security Secretary Napolitano didn't write the report or commission the report (the report was commissioned by Michael Chertoff, President Bush's Homeland Security Secretary) - she just publically released what Bush Administration flunkeys wrote... Yes, we found out Napolitano's views on one thing - that the U.S. Government shouldn't hide government reports from the people. And because she released the report, we now know what the Bush Administration's views were about the possibility of military veterans becoming a danger to the United States (or at least former Secretary Chertoff's views were). Seems the persons that needs to publically apologize is former Secretary Chertoff or former President Bush - but don't hold your breath...

content: Stay the course? Mission Accomplished? I followed my convictions? What is your point anyway? Someone released a memo written by the Bush administration and it's unfavorable and that makes it the fault of the person releasing it? Apparently transparency is only required from certain individuals... Of all escape mechanisms, Death is the most efficient. ~~ H.L. Mencken

content: You release a document OVER YOUR SIGNATURE, you own it. I think it incredable to then say, "Never read it, it's Bush's fault, would have prefered to describe Vets differently." You have one chance to make amends, and it was blown.
